Abstract: This study explores the application of machine learning in the digital measurement of psychological health, leveraging digital phenotyping and psychometrics to identify novel biomarkers. By analyzing large-scale datasets, we demonstrate the effectiveness of machine learning algorithms in detecting subtle changes in mental health patterns, enabling early intervention and personalized treatment. Our findings highlight the potential of digital biomarkers in revolutionizing the field of psychological health, offering a more precise and efficient approach to diagnosis and monitoring.
